channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Singaporeans accept some privacy loss in Covid-19 battle but surveillance method matters: IPS survey
item.description:
May 25, 2020 8:39 PM

SINGAPORE - Singaporeans are willing to sacrifice some level of privacy amid the coronavirus pandemic in order to keep safe and resume their normal activities as soon as possible, but the type of technology and how it is used determines public acceptability, a study has found.

item.title: NDP organisers exploring opt-out option for funpacks, says MP; Govt seeks feedback on issue
item.description:
May 25, 2020 8:21 PM

This comes after a petition launched last Thursday to allow people to opt out of receiving the NDP funpack garnered nearly 80,000 signatures as of Monday.

item.title: Singapore’s cautious approach to reopening after Covid-19 circuit breaker prioritises both lives and livelihoods: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
May 25, 2020 6:26 PM

"If all goes well, then we will move to the next phase around the end of June, and resume more activities then," he said.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some govt service centres to reopen in Phase 1 of post-circuit breaker period
item.description:
May 25, 2020 6:19 PM

Government service centres dealing with issues such as housing, employment passes and taxes will reopen on June 2 but services will be only by appointment.

item.title: Jobs a key part of 4th coronavirus support package, President gives in-principle support to draw on reserves
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:10 PM

The Government had earlier announced three Covid-19 support packages amounting to $63.7 billion.

item.title: 344 new coronavirus cases in Singapore; 4 Singaporeans and PRs
item.description:
May 25, 2020 3:10 PM

The Ministry of Health said the lower number of cases today is partly due to fewer tests being conducted.

item.title: Coronavirus: Automated escalator handrail cleaner on trial at KKH
item.description:
May 25, 2020 2:28 PM

The device is fitted with a human traffic counter to monitor the size of the crowd and cleaning efficiency can be stepped up at high traffic areas.

item.title: Coronavirus: Car sales can be conducted safely, says trade association
item.description:
May 25, 2020 11:38 AM

SINGAPORE - Motor traders have sent an appeal to the government to allow vehicle sales to resume when the circuit breaker is lifted next month.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 25
item.description:
May 25, 2020 8:15 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Monday, May 25.

item.title: Home in focus: From one brother to another
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Every day, at around 10am, a black sport utility vehicle pulls up in the Tuas View area. Out steps Pastor Samuel Gift Stephen, who arrives for what he calls his "Meet-the-People Sessions" with migrant workers staying in factory-converted dormitories (FCDs) in the area.

item.title: On social media
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

ZOE IN NEW YORK, 1997: Home-grown actress Zoe Tay posted a picture of herself in 1997 on Instagram last Saturday.

item.title: Pre-school turns Zoom class into celebration
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Pupils did not get to experience the customary Hari Raya festivities in school this year, but some pre-schools did not let the circuit breaker get in the way of marking the occasion.

item.title: Maintain a positive mindset, S'pore Mufti tells Muslims
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic which cast a shadow over Hari Raya Aidilfitri celebrations this year is an inconvenience which Muslims need to adapt to and they must maintain a positive mindset, said Mufti Nazirudin Mohd Nasir in his annual sermon yesterday.

item.title: PM Lee calls leaders to extend greetings
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong has extended greetings to leaders of Singapore's neighbouring countries for Hari Raya Aidilfitri, his office said yesterday.

item.title: Contractors gear up to meet new safety requirements
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Contractors like Wee Chwee Huat Scaffolding and Construction are now gearing up to comply with new safety measures that have to be in place before they can resume work from June 2 when Singapore enters the first phase of the economy's re-opening after the circuit breaker.

item.title: 700 paid R&D traineeship places created for fresh grads
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

In the last three months, final-year mathematics and economics student Lynette Lua, 23, has applied for jobs in more than 60 companies.

item.title: Childcare centre worker among 3 new S'porean Covid-19 cases
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

A childcare centre employee was among three Singaporeans confirmed to have Covid-19 yesterday.

item.title: Where to apply
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

These are some examples of where fresh polytechnic and university graduates can apply for research traineeship positions:

item.title: Social service sector to get more help in new support package
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The upcoming Covid-19 support package will include ways to help the social service sector, said Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat yesterday.

item.title: Dishing out free meals, mental health support to F&B workers
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Some food and beverage (F&B) outlets have stepped up to provide free meals for workers in the industry, which has been hammered by the pandemic.

item.title: Weekend trip to Bangkok? Not happening any time soon
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The industry is looking at a time lag of three years at least before business returns to pre-Covid days.

item.title: Duo start initiative to help rental flat families
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Good friends David Hoe and Francesca Wah both experienced hardship growing up, so they are more than ready to help families hit hard by the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Expect delays and inconvenience as air travel resumes
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

As a growing number of airlines prepare to resume more flights in the coming weeks, passengers should expect delays, inconvenience and possibly higher fares.

item.title: Nando's serves up 300 free meals daily for those in need
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

In an initiative that began two weeks ago, Nando's has given out more than 1,500 free meals to those in need as of last Friday.

item.title: S'pore Mufti urges Muslims to adjust, adapt and be nimble
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

The coronavirus cast its long shadow over Hari Raya Aidilfitri celebrations this year, with the traditional recitation of prayers, or takbir, confined to homes and large gatherings disallowed.

item.title: Thanking town council cleaners with kindness packs
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

In an effort to thank town council cleaners for keeping the community clean amid the Covid-19 outbreak, two groups banded together to distribute appreciation packs ahead of Hari Raya Puasa.

item.title: President Halimah hosts Istana's first virtual open house
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Every year, the Istana welcomes visitors on Hari Raya Aidilfitri.

item.title: RSAF servicemen keep up their duties amid pandemic
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Being away from home is nothing unusual for air force veteran Vijaikumar, but being on operational duty while isolated at Sembawang Air Base has taken some getting used to.

item.title: How Covid-19 is changing what Singaporeans shop for online
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

From dumb-bells to bubble tea pearls, consumers are now looking for things they may not have previously wanted, as they adjust to the "new normal" amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Foster children add to family's festive joy
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

This year's Hari Raya Aidilfitri feels different to Ms Siti Raziah Raffee.

item.title: Family of cancer victim raising funds to get her home from US
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

Hopes of a fresh start in the United States for a Singaporean woman have turned into a nightmare as she battles inoperable cancer alone, while her family here struggles to bring her home so she can spend her last days with her loved ones.

item.title: First Hari Raya away from home for police NSman
item.description:
May 25, 2020 5:00 AM

For the first time in 27 years, Mr Haziq Azli spent Hari Raya away from his family.

item.title: Turning his tech passion into purpose at Republic Polytechnic
